intro: Cosmibuena pohlii, commonly known as the Pohli's cosmos, is a rare and unusual plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It is adapted to thrive in dry, sandy soils and requires minimal water. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
